Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: You feel skeevy and dirty when you do it. But you do it anyway and you change it back as soon as you can, because you don’t want to start getting the Republican mailings,
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: to vote in more competitive Republican primaries, then changing back for the general election
knowing voters personally and keeping up on issues helped [Ross Diercks] hold office

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Dozens of locals gathered outside to honk and cheer as one Democrat left town.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: showing support for Ed Fullmer as he left for the state championship

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Associated Press election data, Niobrara County’s Democrats, who account for just 2.6% of registered voters, are the most outnumbered by Republicans in the 30 states that track local party affiliation.
Nationwide, Democrats account for fewer than 3% of voters in three counties this year, up from one county in 2020 but down from seven in 2016, according to the AP data.

Named Person Sources.Source Justification: one of just 32 Democrats in Niobrara County

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Party-switching had “undermined the sanctity of Wyoming’s primary process,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: on the new law banning party-switching

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Wyoming Legislature, where the GOP controls over 90% of the seats, passed legislation last year banning voters from changing their party registration in the three months before the August primary.
Wyoming’s Republican and Democratic primaries on Tuesday will be the first in modern memory where voters won’t be able to change party affiliation at the polls.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: holding primaries with new party-switching law
